newsitem.title: FRANCE: Firs raises estimate for 96/97 French sugar crop.
newsitem.headline: Firs raises estimate for 96/97 French sugar crop.

text.p: French sugar intervention board FIRS on Thursday it revised upwards its estimate for the 1996/97 beet sugar crop to 4.1 million tonnes from last month's 4.05 million target.
In its November report FIRS also said that if harvest conditions remained favourable, final output may be near the 4.199 million tonnes produced in 1995/96.

"If harvest conditions remain good, the impact of a drought in July and August on sugar yield may be wiped out. Production in 1996/97 would thus be close to the 4.199 million tonnes reached in 1995/96," FIRS said.
The 4.1 million tonnes crop estimate assumes a sugar yield of 9.72 tonnes per hectare against 9.60 tonnes targeted last month and 9.77 tonnes reached last season.
FIRS linked the upward revision to a sharp rise in sugar content.
"Beet weight per hectare remains below that of past years but sugar content is sharply higher in almost all regions," it said. --Paris newsroom +331 4221 5432
